workflow.name: btap_create_necb_prototype_building
workflow.description: This measure creates an NECB prototype building from scratch and uses it as the base for an analysis.

arguments.display_name: Fenestration and Door to Wall Ratio (set a value between 0 and 1, or set to 1.1 or ignore to use NECB maximum).
arguments.name: fdwr

arguments.display_name: Skylight to Roof Ratio (set a value between 0 and 1, or set to 1.1 or ignore to use NECB maximum).
arguments.name: srr

workflow.name: btap_set_infiltration
workflow.description:
Replace all Space Infiltration objects with a new one that has a prescribed flow rate per exterior surface area.  There are many strategies that can be used to reduce infiltration.

Seal Windows ? Seal all windows and doors with weather strip and fill any air gaps with insulation and caulking to prevent air infiltration.

Install Revolving Doors on the Inner Door Entrance - Replace the high traffic entrance doors with revolving doors.  This will reduce the air infiltration associated with the doors.  Notice that loading dock doors and handicapped accessible entrances cannot be replaced with revolving doors.

Install an Air Curtain for the Loading Dock Door - An air curtain should be installed in the entryway of loading dock doors.  This will greatly reduce outside air from infiltrating during periods of time when loading dock doors are open.

Identify and seal other sources of infiltration ? Look for other uncontrolled infiltration sources and work to air seal.  These could be former electrical chases, abandoned HVAC ducting, general envelope deterioration, or many other sources.

arguments.display_name: Space Infiltration Flow per Exterior Envelope Surface Area (cfm/ft^2).
arguments.name: infiltration_ip

arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Costs for Building per Exterior Envelope Area ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_ip

arguments.display_name: O & M Costs for Construction per Area Used ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: om_cost_ip

workflow.name: btap_set_envelope_conductance_by_necb_climate_zone
workflow.description: Modifies walls, roofs, and windows conductance by climate zone.

workflow.name: btap_set_envelope_conductance_by_necb_climate_zone_2
workflow.description: Modifies walls, roofs, and windows conductance by climate zone.

workflow.name: btap_set_envelope_conductance_by_necb_climate_zone_2_2
workflow.description: Modifies walls, roofs, and windows conductance by climate zone.

workflow.name: reduce_electric_equipment_loads_by_percentage
workflow.display_name: Reduce Electric Equipment Loads by Percentage
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Reduce Electric Equipment Loads by Percentage
workflow.description: Reduce electric equipment loads. This will affect equipment that have a, power, power per area (LPD), or power per person value. This can be applied to the entire building or a specific space type. A positive percentage represents an increase electric equipment power, while a negative percentage can be used for an increase in electric equipment power.

arguments.display_name: Apply the Measure to a Specific Space Type or to the Entire Model.
arguments.name: space_type

arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Cost for Electric Equipment per Floor Area (%).
arguments.name: material_and_installation_cost

arguments.display_name: Increase in Demolition Costs for Electric Equipment per Floor Area (%).
arguments.name: demolition_cost

arguments.display_name: Demolition Costs Occur During Initial Construction?
arguments.name: demo_cost_initial_const

arguments.display_name: Increase O & M Costs for Electric Equipment per Floor Area (%).
arguments.name: om_cost

workflow.name: add_overhangs_by_projection_factor
workflow.description: Add overhangs by projection factor to specified windows. The projection factor is the overhang depth divided by the window height. This can be applied to windows by the closest cardinal direction. If baseline model contains overhangs made by this measure, they will be replaced. Optionally the measure can delete any pre-existing space shading surfaces.

arguments.display_name: Remove Existing Space Shading Surfaces From the Model
arguments.name: remove_ext_space_shading

arguments.display_name: Remove Existing Space Shading Surfaces From the Model
arguments.name: construction

workflow.description:
Replace all Space Infiltration objects with a new one that has a prescribed flow rate per exterior surface area.  There are many strategies that can be used to reduce infiltration.

Install an Air Curtain for the Loading Dock Door - An air curtain should be installed in the entryway of loading dock doors.  This will greatly reduce outside air from infiltrating during periods of time when loading dock doors are open.

workflow.name: btap_new_spacetype_lpd_list
workflow.description: This  measure changes space type LPD based on associated json file in the resource folder.

workflow.name: resize_existing_windows_to_match_a_given_wwr
workflow.display_name: Resize existing windows to match a given WWR
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Resize existing windows to match a given WWR
workflow.description:
This measure aims to resize all of the existing windows in order to produce a specified, user-input, window to wall ratio.
The windows will be resized around their centroid.
It should be noted that this measure should work in all cases when DOWNSIZING the windows (which is often the need given the 40% WWR imposed as baseline by ASHRAE Appendix G).
If you aim to increase the area, please note that this could result in subsurfaces being larger than their parent surface

arguments.display_name: Only affect surfaces that have boundary condition = "Outdoor"?
arguments.name: check_outdoors

workflow.name: btap_change_cav_to_vav
workflow.description: This measure examines all air loops and swaps CAV with VAV systems

workflow.name: btapadddoassys
workflow.description: Measure replaces existing HVAC system (if any) with an Air Source Heat Pump (ASHP) with DOAS HVAC system (one DOAS per floor).  The ASHP with DOAS system (centralized DOAS, with zone level conditioning) is applied to all space types.  In select cases, the user is given the option to preserve existing HVAC schedules.  In other cases, new schedules are generated that align with AEDG recommendations.  The resulting HVAC system reflects the HVAC recommendations of the 50% Small and Medium Office AEDG.

arguments.display_name: Choose which zones to add DOAS to
arguments.name: zonesselected

workflow.name: btap_add_ashpwh
workflow.description: Replaces existing water heater with a ASHPWH

arguments.display_name: Which type of water should be replaced?
arguments.name: wh_type
